sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The &app; application enables you to configure Gnome desktop wallpapers in unique way. You could have Gnome desktop wallpaper changes when the specified time has passed. The most important feature is you could have Gnome desktop wallpaper changes when you change workspace. It means you could group your wallpapers into spesific workspace. It offers quick orientation cues where you are. You can manage it so when you change to first workspace, your desktop wallpaper will be picked from wallpapers group for that workspace. When you change to second workspace, it will be picked from wallpapers group for second workspace. So you could have situation like this. You change to third workspace and you will get cartoon desktop wallpaper (wallpapers group for that workspace consists of cartoon wallpapers only). You change to fourth workspace and you will get abstract desktop wallpaper (wallpapers group for that workspace consists of abstract wallpapers only). Off course you can disable this feature if you just want your desktop wallpaper changes when the specified time (specified by you) has passed and does not change when you change workspace.

sect2.title: Starting &appname;
sect2.para: You can start &app; in the following ways:

listitem.para: Choose Accessories Wallpapoz from the Applications menu.
Run wallpapoz at the prompt in a terminal such as gnome-terminal, or from the Run Application dialog.

sect2.title: Closing &appname;
sect2.para: To close a &app; window choose File Quit, or press CtrlQ. This will shut down the application.

sect2.title: &appname; Features
sect2.para: &app; has a variety of features to help you manage your Gnome desktop wallpapers. You can set the preference so when you change workspace, your Gnome desktop wallpaper will change. Another preference that can be set is when the specified time has passed, your Gnome desktop wallpaper will change.

&app; does more than Gnome Desktop Background Preferences. It supports grouping wallpapers into workspace. So if the preference changing desktop wallpaper when changing workspace is set on, when you change to a workspace, your wallpaper will be picked from wallpapers group for that workspace.

&app; makes it easy for grouping wallpapers into workspace. You can add multiple image files or a directory of image files into workspace. &app; has option whether picking wallpaper in random order or not. Beside that &app; has model option for showing desktop wallpaper.

sect1.title: Getting Started
sect1.para: The &app; window contains the following elements:

listitem.para: The menus on the menubar contain all of the commands that you need to work with &app;.
The buttons toolbar contains a subset of the commands that you can access from the menubar.
The display area displays the wallpaper in mini version when you select it from the treeview.
The treeview represents the list of wallpapers that you have choosen.

sect1.para: Most actions in &app; can be performed several ways. For example, you can add wallpapers in the following ways:

listitem.para: Choose File Add Wallpapers (Files) and select an image file or image files in the Choose Wallpapers dialog.
Click on the Add Files button in buttons toolbar and select an image file or image files in the Choose Wallpapers dialog.
Press CtrlF and select an image file or image files in the Choose Wallpapers dialog.

sect1.title: Adding Wallpapers

sect2.title: Adding Files
sect2.para: To add wallpapers (files), perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Choose FileAdd Wallpapers (Files) , or click on the Add Files button in buttons toolbar, or press CtrlF .
In the Choose Wallpapers dialog, select wallpapers you want to add.

sect2.title: Adding Directory
sect2.para: Instead adding files, you can add a directory of wallpapers. Perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Choose FileAdd Wallpapers (Directory) , or click on the Add Directory button in buttons toolbar, or press CtrlD .
In the Choose Directory dialog, select directory of wallpapers you want to add.

sect2.para: In Choose Directory dialog you have recursive option located on left bottom part. If you select this option, it will get wallpapers recursively inside the directory that you choose. If you do not select this option, it get wallpapers from top level of inside directory that you choose only.

sect1.para: You can add wallpapers to the list of wallpapers. Wallpapers that you add will be put below your selections in treeview.

sect1.title: Editing List of Wallpapers
sect1.para: You can see the list of wallpapers in treeview, the left side of &app;. You can modify this list. The modifications are done in memory and alter the configuration file on disk only when the configuration file are saved with the save function (see save).

sect2.title: To Cut Wallpapers
sect2.para:
To cut wallpapers in the list of wallpapers, select wallpapers in treeview, then choose
Edit Cut , or right click in treeview with mouse then choose Cut from popup menu, or press CtrlX .

sect2.title: To Copy Wallpapers
sect2.para:
To copy wallpapers in the list of wallpapers, select wallpapers in treeview, then choose
Edit Copy , or right click in treeview with mouse then choose Copy from popup menu, or press CtrlC .

sect2.title: To Paste Wallpapers
sect2.para:
To paste wallpapers in the list of wallpapers (you must copy or cut wallpapers first), select treenode in treeview, then choose
Edit Paste , or right click in treeview with mouse then choose Paste from popup menu, or press CtrlP .

sect2.title: To Rename Workspace
sect2.para:
To rename workspace (if you have set the option changing desktop wallpaper when changing workspace on), select workspace (top level treenode) in treeview, then choose
Edit Rename Workspace , or right click on top level treenode in treeview with mouse then choose Rename Workspace from popup menu, or press CtrlE . After that the treenode representing workspace will become text field. You can change the value there. To commit it you can press Enter.

sect2.title: To Change Wallpaper
sect2.para:
To change wallpaper, select single wallpaper in treeview, then choose
Edit Change , or right click in treeview with mouse then choose Change from popup menu, or press CtrlH . In the Choose Wallpaper dialog, select wallpaper that you want as replacement. Click Change.

sect2.title: To Delete Wallpapers
sect2.para:
To delete wallpapers, select wallpapers in treeview, then choose
Edit Delete , or right click in treeview with mouse then choose Delete from popup menu, or press Delete.

sect2.title: To Move Up Wallpapers
sect2.para:
To move up wallpapers, select wallpapers (treenodes) in treeview, then choose
Edit Move Up , or right click in treeview with mouse then choose Move Up from popup menu, or press Page Up. Your selection of wallpapers will move up by one position.

sect2.title: To Move Down Wallpapers
sect2.para:
To move down wallpapers, select wallpapers (treenodes) in treeview, then choose
Edit Move Down , or right click in treeview with mouse then choose Move Down from popup menu, or press Page Down. Your selection of wallpapers will move down by one position.

sect1.title: Saving
sect1.para:
To save the list of wallpapers into configuration file, choose
File Save , or click Save button in buttons toolbar, or press CtrlS .

sect1.title: Preferences
sect1.para: Preferences can be changed by going to EditPreferences, or click Preferences button in buttons toolbar, or press CtrlP . You will be able to change the options for time to be waited for before changing desktop wallpapers, whether picking wallpaper from the list of wallpapers in random order or not, whether changing desktop wallpaper when changing workspace or not, and style to be used for displaying desktop wallpaper.

listitem.para: Use the Change desktop wallpaper after ... minutes spinbox to specify how long before desktop wallpaper is changed to wallpaper that picked from the list of wallpapers.

Select the Pick wallpaper in random order option to pick wallpaper from the list of wallpapers in random order. If you do not select this option, &app; will pick wallpaper from the list of wallpapers in sequence order.

Select the Change desktop wallpaper when changing workspace option to change desktop wallpaper when you change workspace. If you do not select this option, &app; will not change desktop wallpaper when you change workspace.

Use the Style combobox to specify what style &app; should use to display desktop wallpaper. There are Centered, Filled Screen, Scaled, Zoom, Tiled options. This feature is same as in Gnome Desktop Background Preferences.

sect1.title: Daemon
sect1.para: &app; consists of two programs. The first is the gui tool configuring the list of wallpapers. The second is the program that monitors your desktop continously. When you change your workspace or the specified time has passed, it will change your desktop wallpaper based on configuration file that you have been created with the gui tool. The gui tool is called &app; and the daemon is called Daemon Wallpapoz. You can call the Daemon Wallpapoz program and stop it from the gui tool.

note.para: It is the Daemon Wallpapoz program that enables you to have Gnome desktop wallpaper changing when you change workspace or the specified time has passed (based on your configuration file). &app; program just makes the configuration file only.

sect2.title: Run/Restart Daemon
sect2.para:
To run or restart the Daemon Wallpapoz program, choose
Daemon Restart , or click Restart button in buttons toolbar, or press CtrlR . To run Daemon Wallpapoz in other way, run daemon_wallpapoz at the prompt in a terminal such as gnome-terminal, or from the Run Application dialog.

sect2.title: Stop Daemon
sect2.para:
To stop the Daemon Wallpapoz program, choose
Daemon Stop , or click Stop button in buttons toolbar, or press Esc. The other way is to run pkill daemon_wallpapoz at the prompt in a terminal such as gnome-terminal, or from the Run Application dialog.
